segments.text: I have some good news for you . We've decided we'd like to send you to Shanghai on a business trip this weekend .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Don't you think that it'd be a good thing for you to get out of the office foe a couple of days ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I thought you'd be a bit more excited about this . Everything will be paid for and I'll send my assistant with you to take care of everything for you . All you have to do is to get on the train tonight at 7 pm .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: The train ? Will I be flying back then ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , no . We've bought your return ticket for you . I think you'll find it comfortable .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Will the train be very crowded ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh no . the train hasn't been crowded at all recently . Besides , you're in first-class , so you'll be fine .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: When is the first meeting then ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: They've scheduled the negotiation meeting for 9
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: We've booked you a room in the same hotel as your meetings , so you won't need to deal much with the transportation system .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That's very sensible . Would it be alright if I left early today to prepare for the trip ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That's not a problem . Have a nap if you can . You don't know how tight the schedule is for this business trip .
segments.speaker: S1
